creator: morpheus@alumni.princeton.edu
text:
There's no documentation available on the <Cluster> nested component available.
 The only way users know that it exists is that it appears in the default
server.xml.

Ok, I found the Clustering HOW-TO, but there should at least be a link to the
HOWTO from the configuration reference
(http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-5.0-doc/config/index.html).

It would be even better if that information was just folded into the reference.
creator: morpheus@alumni.princeton.edu
funkman@joedog.org
text:
Its bullet 18 off of the home page.

http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-5.0-doc/index.html

But this is such a simple fix that would make the documentation much more
helpful.  Just add a link under the "Nested Components" section to the cluster
HOWTO from the "Configuration Reference" pages.  

I'd also point out that there really isn't any description of what clustering
is, the HOWTO just assumes you know what it is and tells you how to configure it.

Ideally the config reference should be complete unto itself, a la httpd's config
reference, but that's a whole other issue.

I won't reopen if this gets resolved wontfix again.
creator: morpheus@alumni.princeton.edu
funkman@joedog.org
text:
It is well known the documentation for tomcat is lacking. All documentation bugs
are usually marked as WONTFIX or invalid since a documentation bug report won't
help without a patch to fix it. 

In cases where gaps exist (like this bug description) - a patch to the docs in
error usually get patched in a reasonable time. 

[If you re-open with a patch, we won't mind ;) ]
